author: marioevz
content:
Execution spec tests new release ‚ú®  https://github.com/ethereum/execution-spec-tests/releases/tag/v2.0.0

There are breaking changes included, so please take a look at the release notes!

author: chfast
content: `ShanghaiToCancunAtTime15k` is not valid revision for a StateTest.

author: marioevz
content: Thanks for checking the tests and bringing this up! It's an easy fix and can be avoided completely in the future by throwing an exception if a state test attempts to use a transition fork, I'll open up a PR with the fix asap üëç

author: chfast
content: I reported the issue. I think you should resolve the concrete fork name at test generation using the block number.

author: chfast
content: How are you generating a `StateTest` when the test definition has multiple transactions/blocks?

author: marioevz
content: It doesn't allow multiple transactions or blocks, it's just that it allows for any fork, and possibly when converting the tests from blockchain tests we left some test with the transition fork
